interface.name: org.freedesktop.NetworkManagerSettings.Connection
interface.tp:docstring: Represents a single network connection configuration.

method.name: Update
method.tp:docstring: Update the connection with new settings and properties, replacing all previous settings and properties.

method.name: GetSettings
method.tp:docstring: Get the settings maps describing this object.

arg.name: settings
arg.tp:docstring: The nested settings maps describing this object.

signal.name: Removed
signal.tp:docstring: Emitted when this settings object was removed. FIXME: Is this emitted after it was removed or when it is about to be removed? If after removed, then different semantics to Device removed. if prior to removal, should be called AboutToBeRemoved.

interface.name: org.freedesktop.NetworkManagerSettings.Connection.Secrets
interface.tp:docstring: Secrets have a separate interface so that they can be locked down.

method.name: GetSecrets
method.tp:docstring: Get the secrets encapsulated in this object.

arg.name: setting_name
arg.tp:docstring: Name of the setting to return.

arg.name: hints
arg.tp:docstring: Array of strings of key names in the Setting for which NM thinks a secrets may be required.

arg.name: request_new
arg.tp:docstring: Indicates whether new secrets should be requested or if the request can be fulfilled from storage.

arg.name: secrets
arg.tp:docstring: Nested settings maps containing secrets. Each setting MUST contain at least the 'name' field, containing the name of the setting, and one or more secrets.
